snippet: Books about genealogy and the history of New York City; the photographer Eve Arnold; and the abolitionist Sydney Howard Gay’s contribution to the Underground Railroad.
abstract: Sam Roberts reviews books Eve Arnold by Janine di Giovanni, Secret Lives of the Underground Railroad in New York City: Sydney Howard Gay, Louis Napoleon and the Record of Fugitives by Don Papson and Tom Calarco and New York Family History Research Guide and Gazetteer from the New York Genealogical and Biographical Society.
lead_paragraph: Books about genealogy and the history of New York City; the photographer Eve Arnold; and the abolitionist Sydney Howard Gay’s contribution to the Underground Railroad.
